roleset.name: removal of material from the surface of an object; removal of functionality; controlled surgical removal of a body part
roleset.note: ABLATE-V NOTES: Based o Sharp and Thyme data. Comparison to ablation.01-n. Ablate.01 fits with VN class remove-10.1. Framed by Katie. (from ablate.01-v) Extended for Bio AMRs by Bianca and Ulf.
COBLATION-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to ablation.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from coblation.01-n)

example.name: with arg 1 and instrument
example.text: A 1.5 cm, flat, villous-appearing lesion was ablated with gold probe ablation

example.name: Al args
example.text: The parents were grateful to the surgeons for their ablation of the cardiac neural crest from the embryos.

example.name: You have three turbinates in each side of your nose
example with agent
example.text: Next, we ablated NK3R-expressing neurons in the MnPO and monitored the thermoregulatory axis.

example.name: example with instrument
example.text: Phosphorylation of this Akt subspecies was ablated with methyl-B-cyclodextrin, a cholesterol-binding compound, under conditions where nonlipid raft-resident Akt was unaffected.
